content: We had a small discussion earlier about embedding blueprint TeX right inside Lean, and some weren't so keen on it. But now that we've been doing it for a while in this project, I'd like to record the following. Besides the fact that it greatly helps Copilot to generate Lean from TeX (and vice-versa!), it also makes it 1000 times easier when reorganizing. On quite a few occasions, I've wanted to grab large chunks of code+text and move them around somewhere else in the page, or to another file. Imagine how much more time-consuming/annoying it would be if I had to do this twice, in a coordinated way between two (or four!) separate documents!...
Why would you need to do it across separate documents? Are you making the Lean files structure match the blueprint structure?
Yes exactly. (Well, except for really trivial small lemmas.) Isn't that how blueprint is meant to work?...
